metadata.synopsis: As players reach the High Hall, they run into the last remnants of the city guard and have a chance to persuade them to stay and fight.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Endgame > Ally Gathering Area > Go through to other side and approach High Hall courtyard.

24.speaker: Watchman Gyordi
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: City watch guards (6) fleeing in a panic towards us, their unit leader yelling to his men.

64.context: CinematicNodeContext: A psionic blast from a mind flayer obliterates two of the city watch to dust.

49.speaker: Watchman Goodge
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: One of the city watch reaches forward in grief towards his fallen comrade.

55.speaker: Watchman Gyordi
55.text: Leave him be - we have to keep running.
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: First guard forcibly urges him away.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Is this how the City Watch valiantly defends its home?

18.speaker: Narrator
18.text: *He's frightened of you, but the very fact that you haven't killed him on sight gives him reason to pause.*

13.speaker: Narrator
13.text: *Can the rumours be true? Are you the mind flayer who could save the city?*

70.speaker: Player
70.text: I'm not like other mind flayers. I'm here to save you. Fight with me.

38.speaker: Narrator
38.text: *You feel his mind buckling, yielding - against his better judgement, he trusts you.*

92.speaker: Watchman Gyordi
92.text: Remarkable... never in all my life did I think... To fight alongside a mind flayer...?
92.context: NodeContext: pondering the impossible in a new light, but not without its edge of desperation

76.speaker: Watchman Gyordi
76.text: Argh. We go back in there, we die. We flee, we last half a day at best...

66.speaker: Watchman Gyordi
66.text: Shit. If this is it, then godsdammit, let's make it count.
66.context: NodeContext: reconciling themself with almost certain death - sadness as they do so

26.speaker: Watchman Gyordi
26.text: City Watch - with me! We'll follow you. To our last breaths.
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: First sentence to other guards, second sentence to player.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: While the High Hall stands, you've no right to leave. Get back to your duty - fight.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Join me in the fight against the brain or I'll turn you into a thrall right now.

53.speaker: Narrator
53.text: *In all his fear, he longed only for this - the freedom of an ultimatum.*

98.speaker: Player
98.text: If you leave now, the brain will kill you anyway, and turn you into its slaves. You may as well fight with me. For your own salvation.

94.speaker: Narrator
94.text: *He's frightened of your illithid ally, but the very fact that it hasn't killed him on sight gives him reason to pause.*

80.speaker: Narrator
80.text: *Can the rumours be true? Is this really the mind flayer who could save the city?*

71.speaker: Player
71.text: This mind flayer is not like the others. This one will save you. Fight with us.

62.speaker: Narrator
62.text: *You see his mind racing through its options, finding only one. Against all his better judgement, it's you and your mind flayer.*

117.speaker: Player
117.text: This mind flayer is my thrall. Fight with us, and we'll defeat the brain together.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Join us, or I'll set the mind flayer on you.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: If you leave now, the brain will kill you anyway, and turn you into its slaves. You may as well fight with me. For your own salvation.

58.speaker: Narrator
58.text: *His words say that he's given up, but buried deep behind them is a fragment of hope. He doesn't want it to be over any more than you do.*

63.speaker: Player
63.text: It's not too late. Fight with us. For Baldur's Gate.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: While the High Hall stands, you've no right to leave. Get back to your duty - fight.

106.speaker: Watchman Gyordi
106.text: No right? Our lives are our right!

22.speaker: Player
22.text: If you leave now, the brain will kill you anyway, and turn you into its slaves. Fight with us, for your own salvation.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: The fires of adversity forge the most noble heroes. Stand by your city. Stand by your people.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: If you leave now, I will hunt you down as the cowards you are. Your choice.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Die a warrior's death, or die a coward - running, pissing your little breeches. Choose.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: When legends recall this day - will you be a valiant sentinel or a cowering runaway?

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Stay and fight - even if you die here, you will die a martyr. Your soul lauded forever.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Run if you must, it will not help. You will be judged, and your soul will be forfeit.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: This world gives you so much - you must fight for it. You know this is your duty.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: You knew the risk when you signed your sword arm to protect this city. Stay.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: Fear is natural right now. But still your heart, focus your mind. Stay - fight - win.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Never turn your back on a predator you don't understand. Running now won't save you.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: To the victor go the spoils - the Duke said anything you find while fighting, you get to keep.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Once I burn these aberrations to dust, I will turn my ire on any who ran on this day.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Let your patron run their magic through these guards - convince them to stay.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Running would be futile, this is exactly what will happen if illithids take Baldur's Gate...

42.speaker: Narrator
42.text: *There's a glimmer of something beyond his words, but in a moment its gone, consumed with fear.*

9.speaker: Watchman Gyordi
9.text: One last run. Then we're clear.

59.speaker: Watchman Gyordi
59.text: I'm sorry. We can't - I'm sorry.
